definition: lit. to pile up (bricks)/to pack/fig. to pad out (writing with fancy phrases)/ornate rhetoric
to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount
to build by laying bricks or stones

sentences.english: They take the answer back to their cave and add it to the pile of opinions.
sentences.chinese: 他們把這些答案帶回自己的窠臼中堆砌起來。

sentences.english: Pile up literalness for time, I like to use woman.
sentences.chinese: 堆砌文字的時候，我喜歡用到女子。

sentences.english: It is propagandistic and manipulates the reader with purple prose.
sentences.chinese: 它用華麗的詞藻堆砌起來的散文勸誘和操縱讀者。

sentences.english: And pile them high at Ypres and Verdun .
sentences.chinese: 將屍體堆砌在伊普爾和凡爾登。

sentences.english: The quintessential example of self-organised criticality is a growing sand pile.
sentences.chinese: 自我組織臨界的典型例子就是一個慢慢堆砌的沙堆。

sentences.english: So life piled up the days on her, and was beyond her control.
sentences.chinese: 這就是生活給她堆砌的日子，由不得她。

sentences.english: On the heated bed, six hands work together to pile the smashed beans into shape.
sentences.chinese: 溫暖的火炕上，六隻手合力把豆泥堆砌成型。

sentences.english: Scrunch up another ball that's slightly smaller for the wrist.
sentences.chinese: 堆砌了另一個球是略小的手腕。

sentences.english: First, blocks were stacked without guides or mortar.
sentences.chinese: 首先，磚塊的堆砌不需要灰泥。

sentences.english: Then take that successful feeling and build on it, with another baby step.
sentences.chinese: 懷着那份成就感，繼續用嬰兒步伐往上堆砌。

sentences.english: The result of this stacking of ions is a cubical crystal of common table salt .
sentences.chinese: 離子的這種堆砌形成了普通食鹽的立方形結晶。

sentences.english: You need to build your stack of poker chips by acknowledging your success.
sentences.chinese: 你需要通過了解自己來堆砌成功的籌碼。

sentences.english: Now I don't need to make excuses for the way I was born.
sentences.chinese: 我現在毋須爲我生下來的模樣而堆砌藉口。

sentences.english: The structure would consist of 8 layers stacked on top of each other which would have a total area of 34 square miles.
sentences.chinese: 該建築由八層堆砌而成，總佔地面積34平方英里。

definition: to pile up/to put layer upon layer/(Tw) (computing) stack
to build a structure out of layered bricks or stones
rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc
to arrange/to spread out/to narrate in detail/to describe at great length/to elaborate
to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount
to build by laying bricks or stones
lit. fine sculpting (idiom); fig. to work with extreme care and precision
to sculpt/to carve (jade)/ornate artwork/overly elaborate prose
